uint last_idx

Detailed Description

Base class for learning rate schedules. Child classes should implement the schedule method to make changes.

Definition at line 44 of file lbann_callback_learning_rate.hpp.

void lbann::lbann_callback_learning_rate::on_epoch_begin ( model *  m  )  [virtual]

Apply the learning rate schedule.

Reimplemented from lbann::lbann_callback.

Definition at line 54 of file lbann_callback_learning_rate.cpp.

00054                                                           {
00055   std::vector<Layer*>& layers = m->get_layers();
00056   for (size_t l = 0; l < layers.size(); ++l) {
00057     Layer* layer = layers[l];
00058     uint idx = layer->get_index();
00059     if (old_lrs.find(idx) != old_lrs.end()) {
00060       float new_lr = schedule(m, layer);
00061       if (new_lr != old_lrs[idx]) {
00062         old_lrs[idx] = new_lr;
00063         layer->get_optimizer()->set_learning_rate(new_lr);
00064         lbann_comm* comm = m->get_comm();
00065         if (comm->am_model_master()) {
00066           std::cout << "Model " << comm->get_model_rank() <<
00067             ": changing layer " << idx << " learning rate to " << new_lr <<
00068             " at epoch " << m->get_cur_epoch() << std::endl;
00069         }
00070       }
00071     }
00072   }
00073 }

virtual float lbann::lbann_callback_learning_rate::schedule ( model *  m,
Layer *  l 
) [protected, pure virtual]

This is called every epoch to potentially update the learning rate.

Parameters:
m The model being trained.
l The layer in the model currently being potentially updated.
Returns:
A new learning rate.

Implemented in lbann::lbann_callback_step_learning_rate, lbann::lbann_callback_acc_learning_rate, and lbann::lbann_callback_custom_learning_rate.

00041   for (size_t l = 0; l < layers.size(); ++l) {
00042     Layer* layer = layers[l];
00043     uint idx = layer->get_index();
00044     if (layer_indices.size() == 0 ||
00045         layer_indices.find(idx) != layer_indices.end()) {
00046       if (layer->get_optimizer() != NULL) {
00047         old_lrs[idx] = layer->get_optimizer()->get_learning_rate();
